From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • ḥirmar, aḥirmar (Llanes)

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /afiɾˈmaɾ/ [a.fiɾˈmaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧fir‧mar

Verb

[edit]

afirmar (first-person singular indicative present afirmo, past participle afirmáu)

  1. to assert

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of afirmar
infinitive afirmar
gerund afirmando
past participle m afirmáu, f afirmada, n afirmao, m pl afirmaos, f pl afirmaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present afirmo afirmes afirma afirmamos afirmáis afirmen
imperfect afirmaba afirmabes afirmaba afirmábemos, afirmábamos afirmabeis, afirmabais afirmaben
preterite afirmé afirmasti, afirmesti afirmó afirmemos afirmastis, afirmestis afirmaron
pluperfect afirmare, afirmara afirmares, afirmaras afirmare, afirmara afirmáremos, afirmáramos afirmareis, afirmarais afirmaren, afirmaran
future afirmaré afirmarás afirmará afirmaremos afirmaréis afirmarán
conditional afirmaría afirmaríes afirmaría afirmaríemos, afirmaríamos afirmaríeis, afirmaríais afirmaríen
subjunctive present afirme afirmes, afirmas afirme afirmemos afirméis afirmen, afirman
imperfect afirmare, afirmara afirmares, afirmaras afirmare, afirmara afirmáremos, afirmáramos afirmareis, afirmarais afirmaren, afirmaran
imperative — afirma — — afirmái —

Further reading

[edit]
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “afirmar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN
  • “afirmar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin affirmāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [ə.firˈma]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [a.fiɾˈmaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

afirmar (first-person singular present afirmo, first-person singular preterite afirmí, past participle afirmat)

  1. to confirm

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of afirmar (first conjugation)
infinitive afirmar
gerund afirmant
past participle masculine feminine
singular afirmat afirmada
plural afirmats afirmades
person singular plural
first second third first second third

vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present afirmo afirmes afirma afirmem afirmeu afirmen
imperfect afirmava afirmaves afirmava afirmàvem afirmàveu afirmaven
future afirmaré afirmaràs afirmarà afirmarem afirmareu afirmaran
preterite afirmí afirmares afirmà afirmàrem afirmàreu afirmaren
conditional afirmaria afirmaries afirmaria afirmaríem afirmaríeu afirmarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present afirmi afirmis afirmi afirmem afirmeu afirmin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • reafirmar

Related terms

[edit]
  • afirmació

Further reading

[edit]
  • “afirmar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “afirmar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “afirmar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “afirmar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Attested since 1287. From Latin affirmāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /afiɾˈmaɾ/ [a.fiɾˈmaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ

Verb

[edit]

afirmar (first-person singular present afirmo, first-person singular preterite afirmei, past participle afirmado)

  1. to confirm, assure
  2. to affirm, declare
  3. to make firm

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • afirmación
  • afirmativo

References

[edit]

  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, Ernesto Xosé González Seoane, María Álvarez de la Granja, editors (2003–2018), “afirmar”, in Tesouro informatizado da lingua galega (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega

[edit]

Portuguese

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • affirmar (obsolete)

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin affirmāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.fiʁˈma(ʁ)/ [a.fiɦˈma(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.fiʁˈma(ʁ)/ [a.fiɦˈma(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /a.fiɾˈma(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /a.fiʁˈma(ʁ)/ [a.fiʁˈma(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /a.fiɻˈma(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.fiɾˈmaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.fiɾˈmaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.fiɾˈma.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: a‧fir‧mar

Verb

[edit]

afirmar (first-person singular present afirmo, first-person singular preterite afirmei, past participle afirmado)

  2. (transitive) to state; to declare; to affirm (to make a declaration) [with que (+ indicative clause) ‘that ...’]
    Synonyms: declarar, asseverar
  4. (transitive) to confirm; to attest (to affirm to be correct, true or genuine)
    Synonyms: confirmar, assegurar, certificar
    Antonym: negar
  6. (transitive) to consolidate (to make firm, secure)
    Synonyms: fixar, consolidar
  8. (pronominal) to earn one’s place; to rise (to earn a reputation or fame)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of afirmar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person

Present afirmo afirmas afirma afirmamos afirmais afirmam

Preterite afirmei afirmaste afirmou afirmamos1, afirmámos2 afirmastes afirmaram
Pluperfect afirmara afirmaras afirmara afirmáramos afirmáreis afirmaram
Future afirmarei afirmarás afirmará afirmaremos afirmareis afirmarão
Conditional afirmaria afirmarias afirmaria afirmaríamos afirmaríeis afirmariam

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • reafirmar

Related terms

[edit]
  • afirmação
  • afirmador
  • afirmante
  • afirmativa
  • afirmativo
  • confirmar
  • firmar
  • firme

Further reading

[edit]
  • “afirmar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin affirmāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /afiɾˈmaɾ/ [a.fiɾˈmaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧fir‧mar

Verb

[edit]

afirmar (first-person singular present afirmo, first-person singular preterite afirmé, past participle afirmado)

  1. (transitive) to state, assert
    Synonym: declarar
  2. (pronominal, fencing) This term needs a translation to English. Please help out and add a translation, then remove the text {{rfdef}}.

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
